div.div: Attention families whose students qualify for free and reduced meals: Until further notice, and/or you receive additional information, meals will be distributed each Monday from 11:30am-12:30pm at the elementary school. If you have questions about this program, please call the central office at 419-658-2808. Thank you.
The Board of Education will be live streamed via youtube on Monday May 11th starting at 5:30pm. You can access the live stream at that time by going to centrallocal.org/stream

div.h3: High School Update via Instant Alert (Monday, April 27th)

div.div:
Good evening Fairview,
This is Mr. Breyman, high school principal, with news about end of the year events, recognition ceremonies, and Fairview High School Graduation. Late last week, the Ohio Department of Education issued a statement to schools that provided strong guidelines for the use of virtual events rather than in-person gatherings. They explained that "congregate graduation ceremonies should not be held."
Like other schools in the Green Meadows Conference, we at Fairview are listening to warnings and following the Ohio Department of Education's advice. This is to keep students and families safe.
First, Fairview High School Graduation will be a virtual ceremony. Our date will stay as-is. The virtual ceremony will occur Sunday, May 24th at 2pm. We are focused on highlighting each of our seniors. In the upcoming weeks, in order to ensure that our seniors get the recognition that they deserve, we need them to check their email daily. This will allow us to communicate and collect images that are necessary for our unique commencement ceremony. Parents, you will be able to record the ceremony for a keepsake.
Next, Friday, May 15th, at 8 pm, Fairview High School will hold a Virtual Prom for Juniors and Seniors. We will raffle prizes during the event.
Unfortunately, the Senior trip to Kalahari has been cancelled. There are no alternatives available for rescheduling during the Covid-19 Health Crisis.
The Scholarship recognition ceremony has also been cancelled on May 3rd. We will utilize the virtual graduation ceremony to publicize our students accolades and honors.
Finally, Please check for outstanding fees. This is especially important for seniors. Be sure to mail payments to the high school office before graduation. Please make checks payable to Central Local Schools.
Fairview family, I thank you for your understanding during this difficult time. We will continue to celebrate our students' achievements. Your care and support for our students is greatly appreciated!

With the goal of providing a public service to the community, Central Local Schools is sharing the following information about local Internet companies. Central Local Schools is not endorsing any company over another. Central Local Schools will list names and information of other Internet companies as they become available. This information was gathered from providers in our area on March 30th 2020, and is subject to change.
Provider: SMTA
Phone Number: 419 899 2121
Special Deals: Free installation for new customers
Monthly Pricing: $55 per month (As long as you choose a yard sign for approximately a month)
Speed: 50 Mbps Download, 25 Mbps Upload
Router: You can use your own, or rent one for an additional $7.95 per month
Provider: MetaLink
Phone Number: 888 999 8002
Special Deals: Free installation
Monthly Pricing: $52.46
Speed: 7 Mbps Download, 1 Mbps Upload
Router: You can use your own, or rent one for an additional $7.95 per month
Provider: SAA.net (BrightNet)
Phone Number: 888 438 8436
Special Deals: Free installation
Monthly Pricing: $54.19
Speed: 7 Mbps Download, 1 Mbps Upload
Router: You can use your own, or rent one for an additional $7.95 per month
Provider: Hughes Net
Phone Number: 844 737 2700
Special Deals: $99 installation up to $299 installation cost depending on location
Monthly Pricing: $84 with wifi modem included
Speed: 25 Mbps Download, 3 Mbps Upload
Modem: Included in price, price might change if you provide your own

Good morning! The high school has a little surprise for you. STORYTIME!!!!!!!!!!!!
We are hoping to offer you stories each day on the Fairview Storytime Google Sites Page Here, which will be read to you by a Fairview high school student, teacher, principal, secretary, janitor, etc. Who knows who might pop in for the day!?!?!?!?!?!?

Please read the following Coronavirus (COVID-19) information packet from our county superintendents and the commissioner of the Defiance County Health Department. Thank you for doing your part to help stop the spread of germs.

div.div: For more information please see the link here.

We have had a few questions regarding the times for the 20mph school zone on U.S. 127 and Blosser road, so we wanted to post the times for everyone. The morning 20mph school zone times are from 7:25am to 8:05am and after school times are 2:45pm to 3:30pm. Have a nice day!

Please support the Fairview Music Program and Music Boosters through the purchase of a Patron Page listing for your family. Your $10.00 contribution ensures your family names to be printed or displayed on the Music Boosters' Patron Page at each band, choir and elementary music performance for the 2019-2020 school year. Please see the attached flyer for more information.

div.h3: Box Tops For Education Mobile App

div.div: Earn cash for our school! No more clipping, all you need is your smartphone. For more information please see the flyer here, thanks!

Central Local's online K12 MealsPlus Payment Center, K12PaymentCenter.com, just released a new Mobile App! It's everything you love about K12PaymentCenter.com right at your fingertips. Make meals payments and pay school fees on one platform with one easy, safe and secure transaction. Just search for "K12PaymentCenter" in the App store and look for the logo in the picture above.
View Student Account balances and track purchases
Add and Transfer money to and between accounts easily
Make one-time payments or set up recurring payments using your debit or credit card
NEW! Contact your district or view the district menu with one click
NEW! Set up push notifications for new fees and low balance alerts

div.p: The Fairview Schools Fund was established in 2013 by community members. The purpose of the Fund is to further enhance the quality of education of the Central Local Schools. Please click here to learn more about how you can contribute to this fund.

p.a: View the Latest Version of "Who's Telling Your Story?"

div.div: Central Local School District, in partnership with the community, will provide an appropriate environment for each student to realize his/her fullest potential as a life-long learner in a global society.
Our students are academically prepared to be enrolled, enlisted, or employed; have opportunities to learn in a high-quality and safe environment; and feel valued and connected.

ul.li: The Board and Administration will work as a team with honesty and integrity.
We will employ a staff that is both dedicated and an inspiration to our students.
High expectations are prerequisite to high achievement.
Success of our district as a whole is the ultimate reflection of the community in which we serve.
The expectation is that we are a customer relations organization and responsive to all our stakeholders.
We will operate efficiently and effectively to remain accountable to our taxpayers.
Even as a successful organization we believe there is always room for improvement.
The Board of Education will establish and continually monitor goals and strategies.
